<![CDATA[CBC | Business News ]]> http://www.cbc.ca/business/?cmp=rss en-ca Thu, 12 May 2016 17:43:35 EDT CBC.ca http://www.cbc.ca/rss/image/cbc_144.gif http://www.cbc.ca/news/?cmp=rss <![CDATA[No sign of Péladeau returning to Quebecor soon: Mulroney]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/quebecor-peladeau-mulroney-1.3579115?cmp=rss 1.3579115 Thu, 12 May 2016 14:34:23 EDT CBC News News/Business

Pierre Karl Péladeau hasn't indicated he is interested in returning to Quebecor Inc. any time soon, according to company board chair Brian Mulroney.

]]> <![CDATA[Postmedia's Godfrey wants lifeline of tax breaks, bigger government ad spending]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/godfrey-bailout-postmedia-newspaper-1.3579215?cmp=rss 1.3579215 Thu, 12 May 2016 13:32:19 EDT Terry Pedwell News/Politics

The head of one of Canada's biggest media empires is calling on Ottawa to spend more on Canadian newspaper ads, and to give greater tax breaks to companies that do the same.

]]> <![CDATA[Rona takeover by Lowe's gets Competition Bureau approval]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/rona-lowes-1.3579955?cmp=rss 1.3579955 Thu, 12 May 2016 17:43:35 EDT The Canadian Press News/Business

Canada's Competition Bureau has given its approval to Lowe's $3.2-billion takeover of Quebec-based Rona, saying it doesn't think the merger will limit consumer choice.

]]> <![CDATA[Insurance industry worried about climate change but keeps eye on the bottom line: Don Pittis]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/fort-mac-climate-insurance-1.3576918?cmp=rss 1.3576918 Thu, 12 May 2016 05:00:00 EDT Don Pittis News/Business

More than 40 years ago, the insurance industry was a leader in warning about the impact of climate change. But as the number of weather-related disasters soars, experts say the business must focus on adapting to climate change, rather than preventing it.

]]> <![CDATA[Enbridge pipelines to resume oilsands shipments shortly as fire risk falls]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/enbridge-pipeline-resumption-1.3578922?cmp=rss 1.3578922 Thu, 12 May 2016 11:00:08 EDT The Canadian Press News/Business

​Enbridge Inc. says its regional pipeline system for the Alberta oilsands will likely be back to full capacity within a matter of days, given the diminished risk from wildfires that have devastated the Fort McMurray area.

]]> <![CDATA[Some Loblaw stores briefly closed today due to computer glitch]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/loblaw-computer-bug-1.3579022?cmp=rss 1.3579022 Thu, 12 May 2016 12:02:06 EDT CBC News News/Business

A computer glitch forced the temporary closure of some grocery stores in the Loblaw chain on Thursday.

]]> <![CDATA[Cheaper internet may be coming after cabinet rejects Bell appeal]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/bell-appeal-bains-1.3577044?cmp=rss 1.3577044 Wed, 11 May 2016 11:16:45 EDT The Canadian Press News/Technology & Science

The federal cabinet is supporting a CRTC decision that forces Canada's big Internet providers to share their high-speed infrastructure with smaller carriers at a wholesale cost.

]]> <![CDATA[Alberta wildfire will drag down Canada's GDP this year, economists say]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/fort-mcmurray-wildfire-prompts-economists-to-trim-outlook-for-this-year-1.3578761?cmp=rss 1.3578761 Thu, 12 May 2016 09:18:35 EDT The Canadian Press News/Business

The effects of the enormous Alberta wildfire on the ever-crucial oil sector have prompted forecasters to trim their 2016 economic growth predictions for the entire country.

]]> <![CDATA[Mobilicity unplugged as Rogers to move all 154,000 customers to Chatr]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/rogers-mobilicity-1.3576840?cmp=rss 1.3576840 Wed, 11 May 2016 12:35:32 EDT CBC News News/Business

Almost a year after buying it for $465 million, Rogers will pull the plug on Mobilicity and move all of the discount wireless company's 154,000 customers to its own discount brand, Chatr.

]]> <![CDATA[Hong Kong-backed Bluesky Hotels bids $2.1B for Canadian hotel REIT InnVest]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/bluesky-innvest-reit-1.3577640?cmp=rss 1.3577640 Wed, 11 May 2016 15:33:17 EDT CBC News News/Business

Canadian hotel owner InnVest REIT's management is backing a friendly $2.1-billion takeover by a private company backed by money from Hong Kong.

]]> <![CDATA[Price of oil hits 2016 high on U.S. inventories data]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/oil-crude-price-1.3578028?cmp=rss 1.3578028 Wed, 11 May 2016 17:45:43 EDT The Canadian Press News/Business

The price of crude rallied to its highest level so far this year as investors were pleasantly surprised by the latest figures on oil stockpiles in the United States.

]]> <![CDATA[Toronto, Vancouver create all Canada's job growth]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/housing-jobs-toronto-vancouver-1.3577061?cmp=rss 1.3577061 Wed, 11 May 2016 12:24:16 EDT CBC News News/Business

Blistering hot housing markets aren't the only things setting Toronto and Vancouver apart from the rest of Canada. The two cities also accounted for all the country's job growth, economists say.

]]> <![CDATA[Canadian Solar raises 2016 revenue forecast]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/canadian-solar-outlook-1.3577909?cmp=rss 1.3577909 Wed, 11 May 2016 17:10:34 EDT The Canadian Press News/Business

Canadian Solar Inc.'s battered stock got a boost Wednesday after its first-quarter results beat analyst estimates and senior executives raised their revenue outlook for the full year by $100 million US — with room to grow even further.

]]> <![CDATA[Hyperloop One technology tested successfully in Nevada desert]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/hyperloop-one-test-1.3577182?cmp=rss 1.3577182 Wed, 11 May 2016 13:08:28 EDT Reuters News/Technology & Science

Hyperloop One, a Los Angeles company working to develop futuristic transportation technology, conducted a successful test of its high speed transportation technology Wednesday in the desert outside Las Vegas

]]> <![CDATA[As Fort McMurray blaze weakens, focus moves to restart of oilsands facilities]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/fort-mcmurray-fire-oilsands-1.3576781?cmp=rss 1.3576781 Wed, 11 May 2016 09:25:46 EDT Reuters News/Business

Market participants are closely watching on Wednesday for the prospect of further restarts by Canadian oil sands producers near wildfire-ravaged Fort McMurray as some companies began slowly bringing operations back online.

]]>
